meanings.definition: Capable of being transmitted from one person or thing to another.
meanings.sent1: The flu virus is transmittable through coughing and sneezing.
meanings.sent2: It is important to wash your hands to prevent transmittable diseases.
meanings.sent3: The rumor about the surprise party was so transmittable that everyone found out.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was transmittable, spreading joy to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room was transmittable, filling the air with anticipation.

meanings.definition: Able to be passed on or communicated to others.
meanings.sent1: The teacher used transmittable methods to explain the complex topic to the students.
meanings.sent2: Clear and concise messages are more transmittable to the audience.
meanings.sent3: The secret code was so transmittable that even the youngest sibling cracked it.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music was transmittable, inspiring others to pursue their dreams.
meanings.sent5: The love for learning was transmittable among the group, creating a supportive environment.
